parent_formation: NOT IN NORTH AFRICA - Division relocated to Palestine/Syria

commander.name: Major-General Alexander Hugh Gatehouse
commander.notes: Continued as division commander after relocation from Egypt

tanks.notes: Estimated strength after post-El Alamein refit. Some combat losses replaced, Grant tanks being phased out in favor of Shermans.

Ordnance QF 25-pounder.notes: Two field regiments RHA, 24 guns each

supply_logistics.supply_status: NOT APPLICABLE - Division not in North Africa theater. Relocated to Palestine 1 January 1943 for rest, refit, and training after El Alamein operations. Not engaged in combat operations during 1943q1.

subordinate_units.notes: DETACHED - Brigade operated independently in Tunisia under New Zealand Corps during Mareth Line operations (March 1943). Not with division in Palestine.
Remained with division in Palestine. Estimated strength based on 1942q4 establishment.

tactical_doctrine.role: NOT IN COMBAT - Rest, refit, and training in Palestine
known_issues: Division not in North Africa during 1943q1
8th Armoured Brigade detached and fighting independently in Tunisia
Division undergoing refit and reorganization after El Alamein campaign
tactical_doctrine.desert_adaptations: Not applicable - division out of theater

operations.name: Relocation to Palestine
operations.role: Division withdrew from Egypt to Palestine for rest and refit

operations.name: Training and Reorganization
operations.outcome: Division not combat-ready, out of North Africa theater

historical_context.combat_effectiveness: NOT APPLICABLE - Division not in combat during 1943q1. Previous combat performance at El Alamein was good, but division withdrawn from line.

source: British Military History website (Tunisia 1942-1943 Armoured Divisions page - confirms 10th Armoured NOT in Tunisia)
Web search results (10th Armoured Division relocated to Palestine 1 January 1943)
8th Armoured Brigade historical records (brigade detached, operated independently in Tunisia)
Previous 1942q4 extraction as baseline for equipment estimates

theater_location.reason: Division not in North Africa theater during 1943q1. Relocated to Palestine on 1 January 1943, spent quarter in Palestine/Syria region.
sources_checked: Web searches for 10th Armoured Division movements
theater_location.mitigation: This unit should potentially be removed from North Africa seed file for 1943q1-q2 as it was not in theater. Only the detached 8th Armoured Brigade fought in Tunisia.

combat_operations.reason: Division not engaged in combat during 1943q1. Undergoing rest, refit, and training in Palestine.
sources_checked: Tunisia Campaign order of battle sources
British armoured divisions in Tunisia documentation
combat_operations.mitigation: Division's previous combat record (Alam Halfa, El Alamein) is well documented in 1942q3-q4 extractions.

8th_armoured_brigade.reason: 8th Armoured Brigade operated independently in Tunisia (Mareth Line, El Hamma) under New Zealand Corps command, not with parent division.
sources_checked: Battle of Mareth Line order of battle
8th_armoured_brigade.mitigation: Brigade should be extracted separately as independent formation if needed for Tunisia scenarios.

supply_logistics.reason: Division not in North Africa theater, not engaged in operations. Supply data not relevant for Palestine garrison duty.

weather_environment.reason: Division not in North Africa theater. Palestine weather not relevant to North Africa TO&E project scope.

validation.notes: CRITICAL FINDING: 10th Armoured Division was NOT in North Africa during 1943q1. Division relocated to Palestine on 1 January 1943 for rest/refit after El Alamein. Only the 8th Armoured Brigade (detached) fought in Tunisia during this period. This extraction is Tier 4 (research brief) because the unit was out of theater. Seed file may need correction - division listed for 1943q1 and 1943q2 but was not in North Africa. Equipment estimates based on 1942q4 strength with minor attrition/replacements assumed.

discovered_units.source: 8th Armoured Brigade historical records, Battle of Mareth Line order of battle
discovered_units.reason: Brigade detached from 10th Armoured Division and operated independently in Tunisia during 1943q1. Fought at Mareth Line (14-26 March 1943) under New Zealand Corps command.
discovered_units.combat_evidence: 8th Armoured Brigade participated in Battle of the Mareth Line (14-26 March 1943), attached to New Zealand Corps. Launched attack towards El Hamma on 26 March as part of Operation Supercharge II, penetrating Switch Line and forcing Axis withdrawal to Wadi Akarit. Clear combat role in major Tunisia Campaign battle.
